items.sentence: How do I know that you aren't just telling me what I want to hear?
Tom was only eighteen years old when he graduated from university.
Tom Jackson gave a speech in front of a large audience last night.
Mary tried on all the dresses, but none of them fit her very well.
Tom was able to buy a gun, but he couldn't buy any bullets for it.
Don't say that you don't have a job. Say that you're between jobs.
The ticket you've bought isn't valid for travel during peak times.
Tom spent all the money he had to buy a birthday present for Mary.
Tom and Mary put their drinks down and started kissing each other.
Tom forgot to lock his bike up, and when he came back it was gone.
